comments.body: your idea is great, but we could have horned sheep too!  Because it's a feature people have been wanting!

What if this was a good time for Mojang to implement herds into Minecraft, sometimes animals would spawn with a specific property "leader", which would cause all other animals of the same variant and species to follow it. This leader could grow horns, suggesting that they are the most dominant. Not all animals species would have a head animal, in fact I think we should just restrict it to the farm animals for the time being as in real life not all animals have family structures. Anyway, vote this up, to let me know what you think.

In the week before the sheep I was so excited for the anticipated sheep variants, only to be meet with disappointment when I saw they just changed their colors. I thought it was low quality and had let the bar down compared to the additons in the drop so far.

We don't have to have different types of wool, just have three different sheep variants. Of course, the sixteen colours of wool would have to be added for each texture but you're not changing the model, so it shouldn't take too long.

bigtime agree. personally i dont see any point in wild dyed wool variants, as most players are only sheering wild sheep in the early game when they need to set up their first bed, in which case color variatns would be DETRIMENTAL and clog the inventory. i also think it takes away from how special it feels to find a wild pink sheep.

I disagree. Thanks to your post, Minecraft reverted back the sheep colors. Mojang could at least add back the sheep colors but with something new about sheep, like the colors only spawn very rarely in jungles or deserts
The suggested ideas down below are great! Horned sheep and the herd idea would be fun, interesting, and refreshing take on the farm animals. I would love to see it.
THIS NEEDS TO BE DONE
naaaaa!!! it's really good
Absolutely needs to be reverted, no one asked for it and just like stack separation this has been in the game forever.
We need this bug to be fixed.
Please change this back. I cant use any machines that require chunkloading. There was no need to "fix" this.
No one asked for this and no one benefits from this. This simply impedes gameplay in technical farms. It needs to be fixed.
Should be reverted

All my chunkloaders broke from this and I'm going to have to rebuild each and every one of them

its more than 45, because I'm loading a huge machine all at once

I just had to fix my storage because i thought only cart and boat chunk loaders were broken...

nope, turns out pumkin one are as well because sometimes they just fly past and through the portal blocks because they r too thin...

this needs to be changed back.
Thunder sandstorms could reduce visibility greatly.
that would add a lot to pools and such
The Leaf clutters especially should!
OOooh, yesss

The simplest version of this could involve varying the color of leaf litter based on the biome, rather than implementing a separate block for each leaf type.

However, just varying the color wouldn't be realistic for spruce needles, and also would restrict players looking to place a certain color litter outside its native biome.

I agree! Considering their texture really causes them to stick out in an unnatural way in some greener biomes, if the team has no plans on changing their texture, then please decrease how common they generate.
Goat only spawn in 1 place it it should not change
I like this idea! In the real world, goats are often known for being farm animals in various environments, so making the ones in Minecraft only mountain goats doesn't feel right.
Goats don't need varients based on bioms, they only spawn in mountains. But i like the idea of more retextured goats tho.
Also, villagers should be able to keep goats as livestock.
Swamps could use more unique plants. There should be some variant of the lily pad that actually has a flowering lily on it.
WOW this is pretty cool i like it!

maybe it loses durability REALLY quickly but also gains it back whenever it isn't held

Great for short bursts of speed

When I build on mega structures, floating so slowly in the air will definitely frustrate me, and I won’t use the ghast in the long run. Having the option to speed up the ghast? I say yes! This way, we keep the default precision and slowness while allowing acceleration when needed.

My sisters are trying out the happy ghast together, and we all think that they are slow. I think that Mojang should increase the speed of the happy ghast so that we can have fun races!

-MDChampion098

I think a crafting recipe like- Ghast tear, phantom membrane, and speed potion combined, upgrades your ghast to speed I. Then that same recipe but with added netherite scrap upgrades your ghast to speed II. 

I'm suggesting netherite scrap because other than for turning into ingots netherite scrap is useless, this would be a neat use for it.
Auto yes
MUDDY PIGS. (FULL STOP)

I like the idea of truffles because it would give a benefit of keeping pigs that doesn't involve killing them. Maybe pigs would only dig up truffles if they're well cared for / have a large pen to walk around, making their gameplay more involved.

There could be more variants of pigs in the game. Dogs/wolves have 9 variants, why not pigs. In addition to the 3 that we already have in the swamps, there could be a mud pig, as many players want. In the jungle there could be pigs that look like babirusas, since we already have the red river hog. In the savannah, on the other hand, a pig that looks like a warthog. Dark oak forest could then have a wild pig. Among the interesting pigs, breeds such as the Hampshire or the Přeštice black-and-white pig could be mentioned. And among the wild ones, the bearded pig or the Visayan warty pig would be interesting.

I think pigs already have a lot of uses. Eating them and riding them is enough. Its not so neccesary to add truffles for pigs to find cause no one will use that feature anyway, and will make the game more complicated

All types of pigs - including Piglins and Hoglins but not the undead variants - should be able to dig up various mushrooms the same way Sniffers dig up ancient seeds.

Major bonus feature to this - in the Nether, probably only in Soul Sand Valleys, digging up Nether Warts is "possible".

I think the main problem with them being only available through exploration is the existance of multiplayer. One player could immediately go to the Nether searching for Soulsand Valley and destroy them all. Or over time, a server could essentially run out of dried ghasts in the same way elytras become rare in large servers. Mojang is making a big push for multiplayer right now (they have even named it "Minecraft: play with friends" on some platforms). If I had to guess, they are probably trying to figure out a good way to make elytras renewable as well. 

It would be much easier to just make them breedable, but honestly I can't think of any way that would make sense lorewise. Maybe by crafting them out of Ghast Tears, you are imbuing the new ghastling with the remnants of the souls of other ghasts. A branch of magic straying into necromancy. The existence of Bone Blocks in the leaked recipe is the thing that really throws me off. I can't imagine how bone blocks would contribute to a Dried Ghast.

One last thing I'll say is that I don't have many Ghast Tears lying around. After a year of playing on my survival world I have maybe a stack. If the leaked recipe is real, I will only be able to make 16 extremely flammable Happy Ghasts.
There are some items you simply shouldn't be able to craft! And the dried ghast is definitely one of them!
Imo ghasts must drop dried ghast rarely
It does feel super weird to craft something that will eventually be a mob (and not a golem).
yesssss
Yep, fully agree with the OP would prefer that Ghastlings only grow when fed a lot of snowballs.
Ooooh, this sounds awesome :)
I was going to post it myself but I'm glad you were quicker than me.
So was I. Thanks for addressing this. I know this will irritate me if they don't make it match w/ the tree type.
yes and please change the saddle style! WHY DOES IT HAVE STIRRUPS?

Nah, its better with more pixels. The 32x32 texture allows it to be more smooth and subtly detailed. If you think about it, the normal ghast is one of the largest mob, but has less pixels than the wither, which is half its size. While the old texture is nostalgic, the new one is simply better and more consistant with literally every other mob.
no it needs less pixels. the game is a simple sandbox, there is no need for HD graphics like these.
It would also be a good accessibility addition for color blind people, making it easier for them to identify which book or potion they are using.

it would be great if they made that change and now the new pixelart they are using is very nice.
the poison potion I would like to see it with this new pixelart they use.
pd: i don't know how they will do with books with many enchantments, i guess books with several enchantments will have a different pixelart like a rainbow.
Sure!
This idea reminds me of the large rock formations found in jungles in Minecraft Legends. Having those in Minecraft as well seems like a great idea!
While I like the idea of more birds being added to Minecraft (real or fictional), I will remind you that chickens aren't the only birds in the game; parrots exist, too.

Parrots exist but they mostly just look pretty and make baby zombie noises to freak you out. The mobs you're talking about exist and are nicely implemented in Mo'Creatures with similar design (doves are a type of Bird and can be tamed with seeds, but ducks and turkeys can't be bred for some reason without Mo'Creatures Extended). It's a mod for Java 1.12 if you want to give it a look. You can eat the non-dove birds, too! If we added ducks to main Minecraft, though, how would we keep them reasonably distinct from chickens? Would they lay eggs, and if so, what would you use them for? How would the meat be functionally different from chickens? I like your ideas and I'd love to discuss them further!
I like ducks but I don't really see the use. Chickens can substitute easily with all their variants for aesthetics and already have the uses mentioned
I would like to say that I actually really love leaf litter. Real forests have lots of leaves on the ground so I think it makes more realistic and immersive.
It looks so s=out of place in forests!

I think the litter is well balanced, when you clear an area near your base the litter slowly accumulates just enough to not cover the ground for a long while, but having leaf litter is a really good way to hear those sneaky creepers.

fr bro my moat has a forest on the island my castle is on in my survival world and they caught on fire cuz of my garbage disposal that uses lava and they almost burned down the whole forest and they wouldve if i didnt notice the fire

Yep, I can't bare to look at modern forests anymore, so I made a datapack in Java edition that disables it but honestly I still don't want normal Minecraft forests to look like this. At least stuff like wildflowers look visually appealing.

Alternatively, I had this idea:

Sad Ghast

When a dried ghast is set on fire, it should turn into a sad ghastling. This is a neutral ghast that is attracted to fireballs. Once fed fireballs, it grows up into a sad ghast, which cannot be stood on and shoots fireballs if attacked, but can have a harness on.
Fun idea but imagine you're building and you click the wrong key... Boom! Building gone
i think this could be an amazing way to replace the TNT duping. by having a renewable way of explosion through the happy ghast

I would make the fireballs a different projectile. There is some ghast lore, i don't know much about it, but i think it would be better if he shoot like big snow balls. Just feed him snow blocks, and he will shoot them. Also i would change the way it fires them. There should be like a limit of ten blocks in a ghast, and he would shoot them automatically at nearby mobs, but you would need to refill him.

Absolutely! Bighorn sheep could have curling horns, and white snouts and tails while blackness sheep could be with black faces, knees, and limbs instead of the usual brown. Their faces could also be wooly! These variants would look super cute! Thanks for suggesting!
Blacknose sheep are adorable. If anyone doesnt know they are the sheep with black faces and long curly white wool. The kind of sheep featured in the Shawn the Sheep show.
yes, i'm hoping they can add more variance than just coloration
Agreed, Flowering Azalea Leaves could even have flowers falling out of them!
Yes it would be beautiful but I don’t know how Mojang can’t understand
agreed with all. additionally, leaf litter should be able to be replaced by placing a block, the same as snow layers or tall grass, due to how common it is
Leaf litter not being placeable on stone has been really annoying me! It would go perfectly as decoration on a stone pathway in a village build i have.
It would be so cool to be able to put the Leaf Litters on the water. I would always use it to decorate my ponds

I think it would be good to make a recipe to process leaf litter into a biofuel or something, cause right now it is barely usable to smelt. Even just a compressed biomass block or something could make a nice fuel.
